The Trumbull Avenue Congregational Church was gathered in 1868 and the name changed to Plymouth Congregational Church after the building moved in 1881. The Church remained active until 1903. This collection contains administrative records and includes trustee meeting minutes, an act of incorporation, and a document related to the sale of church property.

This collection contains administrative records from the Plymouth Congregational Church in Detroit, Michigan. The collection contains a record book of church records which primarily includes the meeting minutes of the trustees, articles of incorporation, and a document related of the sale of church property to the Detroit Congregational Union.

The Trumbull Avenue Congregational Church was gathered in 1868. In 1881, the church building was moved to the northeast corner of the intersection of Trumbull Avenue and Baker Street in the Corktown neighborhood of Detroit. After moving to the new location, the church changed its name to Plymouth Congregational Church.
